value.title: AI’s Role In The Future Of Data Privacy
value.excerpt: People’s personal data has been lost, stolen, exposed, and hacked. Unfortunately, this trend isn’t new and can cost companies an average of $3.86 million per breach, not to mention the harm to the users themselves.

value.title: AI Weekly: WHO outlines steps for creating inclusive AI health care systems
value.excerpt: The World Health Organization (WHO) outlined steps that must be taken for the development of trustworthy AI in health care.

value.title: Oak Brook teen receives Diana Award for nonprofit focusing on AI education
value.excerpt: Jui Khankari’s nonprofit, AInspire, runs entirely on donations and services over 7,500 students in 58 countries with virtual workshops, videos and educational curriculum the 17-year-old girl created.

value.title: Biased AI is not just bad for people, it’s harmful for businesses, too
value.excerpt: Bias in AI is detrimental to society and can also lead to poor decision-making with harmful impact on business processes and profitability.

value.title: Detect manufacturing defects in real time using Amazon Lookout for Vision
value.excerpt: In this post, we look at how we can automate the detection of anomalies in a manufactured product using Amazon Lookout for Vision. Using Amazon Lookout for Vision, you can notify operators in real time when defects are detected, provide dashboards for monitoring the workload, and get visual insights

value.title: 3 Reasons Qualcomm's New Snapdragon Chip Didn't Impress Investors
value.excerpt: Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) recently upgraded its most powerful mobile chipset, the Snapdragon 888, with a "Plus" version that increases its clock speed by 5% to nearly 3.0 GHz and boosts its AI processing power by about 20%.

value.title: It's Good to Talk: How to Donate Your Voice to Help the Future of Speech Recognition
value.excerpt: Voice-based technology is everywhere, but what if your digital assistant doesn't speak your language? The Mozilla Common Voice project wants to change that with a publicly available database of voices from around the globe.

value.title: A New Frontier of AI-Enabled Gadgets
value.excerpt: Researchers are working on a wave of sophisticated devices for the home, from toilets that screen for viruses to robots that find missing keys.

value.title: AI Strategies: What Is Natural Language Processing and How Can It Help Businesses?
value.excerpt: Combining language with technology has driven innovation in artificial intelligence for decades. With the right strategy, it can help businesses today.

value.title: Attackers use ‘offensive AI’ to create deepfakes for phishing campaigns
value.excerpt: In a survey of organizations including Airbus and Huawei, respondents identify the top threats in AI-powered cyberattacks.

value.title: How CFOs Can Think Differently About AI Software Acquisition
value.excerpt: Next, we’ll explore some unique perspectives to consider when investing in AI technology and why these should be an integral part of a CFO’s AI-decision framework.

value.title: LungLife AI Raises GBP17 Mln in London IPO
value.excerpt: By Ian Walker LungLife AI said Friday that it has raised 17 million pounds ($23.4 million) as part of its initial public offering on London's junior AIM.

value.title: AI startup Hypersonix valuation quadruples after $35 million funding
value.excerpt: Hypersonix plans to use the funding for building its Commerce AI infrastructure further, while also focusing on expanding sales and marketing footprint globally, co-founder Rama Rao says.

value.title: Finance Ministry, Microsoft join hands to build AI, emerging tech centre
value.excerpt: The collaboration between AJNIFM and Microsoft is meant to explore the role of cloud, AI and emerging technologies in transforming and shaping the future of public finance management in India

value.title: India Covid-19: AI shows Pakistani Twitter prayed for neighbour

value.title: ‘Roswell: The Final Verdict’ Review: Aliens vs. Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: UFO incident gets re-examined with new technology in this Discovery+ series.

value.title: Maine just enacted the country's toughest restrictions on facial recognition
value.excerpt: A new state law limits police use of facial recognition technology, and prohibits the tech in most areas of government, including in public schools.

value.title: Google Sold $2.5 Million In AI To The Pentagon For Its Covid-19 Recovery
value.excerpt: A previously-undisclosed deal with the Pentagon reveals Google sold AI tech for the DOD’s Covid-19 recovery. But, with no contractual “red line,” there were concerns it could have been repurposed for non-Covid military projects.

value.title: How Can Healthcare Leverage Natural Language Processing for Medical Records?
value.excerpt: As automated solutions continue to gain traction in the industry, here’s how a specialized branch of artificial intelligence is showing promise in improving EHR usability.

value.title: ‘Are you thirsty?’ This AI-enabled robot can bring beer to holiday parties
value.excerpt: Heineken says its autonomous robot can hold up to 12 cans of beer, will follow you down the sidewalk and has a friendly AI personality.

value.title: Amazon plans to build delivery robot tech in Finland
value.excerpt: Amazon announced Thursday that it plans to develop new technology for its autonomous delivery vehicles in Helsinki, Finland.

value.title: After an $8.4M raise, strawberry-picking robotics startup Traptic begins commercial deployment
value.excerpt: We first covered Traptic back in 2019, when it appeared as a Battlefield finalist on stage at Disrupt SF. Today, the South Bay robotics startup is announcing some major progress. For starters, it began commercial deployment of its strawberry-picking mobile robot early this month.

value.title: Bollé Uses Lens Lab And AI For Enhancing Color Contrast, Including Tennis-Specific Sunglasses
value.excerpt: The Bolle EPIC lab in Lyon, France, used artificial intelligence to sort through millions of lens formula combinations to create a fresh perspective on sunglasses and color contrast.
